function.description: Users should be able to enter their height and weight in either metric (meters/kilograms) or imperial (feet/inches/pounds) units.
Upon entering their height and weight, users should be able to click a button to calculate their BMI.
After calculating the BMI, it should be displayed clearly on the page with its corresponding category (underweight, normal weight, overweight, obese).
The calculator could offer an optional feature to estimate body fat percentage based on user-provided height, weight, and gender.
Allow users to easily share their calculated BMI through social media buttons or a copy-to-clipboard functionality.
Allows users to input an amount and select source and target currencies to see the equivalent value.
Shows current exchange rates for major currencies, potentially downloadable as a list or CSV file.
Describes the source of exchange rate data, including updates frequency and accuracy.
Provides a form or email address for users to contact the website developers with questions or feedback.
Allows users to choose their preferred set of currencies for display and conversion.
Users can define how often they want exchange rates to be updated automatically.
Generate a password of specified length and complexity.
Choose from various character sets (uppercase, lowercase, numbers, symbols) to include in the generated password.
Adjust the desired password length using a slider.
Easily copy the generated password to the clipboard for quick use.
Save the generated password as text file.
Learn about the project's purpose, contributors, and development roadmap.
Understand how user data is handled and protected.
Find answers to common questions about password generation and security best practices.

Easily generate QR codes by inputting the desired URL, text, or vCard information.
View a gallery of pre-generated QR code examples for different types of content.
Access a section explaining the benefits and usage of QR codes with various real-world examples.
Modify the dimensions (width and height) of the generated QR code to fit your desired size.
Customize the color scheme by choosing different colors for the foreground (QR code pattern) and background.
Display a logo within each QR code to enhance branding or personalization.
Adjust the error correction level to determine the resilience of the QR code against damage or scanning errors.
Choose from different types of QR codes, such as URL, text, vCard, or file sharing.
Download the generated QR code in various formats like PNG, SVG, or PDF for different usage scenarios.
Copy a shareable URL link to the generated QR code that can be easily distributed online.

6: [{"page":"HomePage", "function":[{"function":"Create Task", "description":"Add a new task with title, description, due date, and priority level."}, {"function":"View All Tasks", "description":"Display a list of all tasks, sorted by due date, priority, or completion status."}, {"function":"Search Tasks", "description":"Filter tasks by keywords in title or description."}, {"function":"Mark Task Complete", "description":"Indicate that a task is finished. Allow for marking partially complete."}, {"function":"Delete Task", "description":"Remove a completed or incomplete task permanently."}]},{"page":"Task Details", "function":[{"function":"Edit Task", "description":"Modify existing task details, including title, description, due date, and priority."}, {"function":"Set Reminder", "description":"Choose a time to be reminded about a task before its due date."}, {"function":"Attach File/Link", "description":"Add relevant files or URLs to a specific task."}]}, {"page":"Analytics", "function":[{"function":"Task Completion Rate", "description":"Visualize the percentage of completed tasks over time, categorized by project or priority"}, {"function":"Productivity Trend", "description":"Display average daily, weekly, or monthly task completion rate"}, {"function":"Time Spent on Tasks", "description":"Analyze the amount of time spent on specific tasks or categories."}]}]}   ]

function.description: Display a calendar for the current month.
Navigate to previous/next month or year.
Highlight a specific date for viewing events or adding tasks.
Display a list of events scheduled for the chosen date.

Edit an event's details, such as title, description, or time.

Clearly describe the AI Chatbot's capabilities and benefits.
Allow users to interact with a basic version of the chatbot to experience its functionality.
Encourage users to sign up for a free trial or request a demo.
Highlight the chatbot's unique features and advantages over competitors.
Provide detailed descriptions and examples of each feature functionality.
Use screenshots, videos or GIFs to illustrate how features work in practice.
Offer clear and competitive pricing options with different tiers based on usage or features.
Outline the benefits and value users receive at each price level.
Provide a free trial period to allow users to test the chatbot before committing.
Answer common user questions about setup, functionality, and billing.
Provide a channel for users to submit support requests or inquiries.
Offer comprehensive guides and tutorials to assist users in getting the most out of the chatbot.
Registered users can log in to access the app, while new users can create an account.
Provides a brief overview of the app's features and how to use it effectively.
Users can log their daily food intake, specifying calories and macronutrients (protein, carbs, fat).
Displays a summary of logged meals, total calories consumed, and progress towards daily goals.
Allows users to define their personalized calorie goal based on their weight loss/maintenance objectives.
Users can search for food items by name, ingredients, or nutrition category.
Displays detailed calorie and macronutrient breakdowns for each food item.
Allows users to add frequently consumed items to a personalized favorites list for quick access.
Displays a history of all logged meals, including dates, food items, and calorie details.
Offers customizable charts and graphs to visualize calorie intake patterns, macronutrient distribution, and progress over time.
Provides insights into user's eating habits, helping them identify potential areas for improvement.

Create a new expense claim and select the relevant category (Travel, Labor, Management, or Equipment). Enter the details of the expense, upload supporting documents, and submit the claim for approval.
View the status of submitted claims (Approved, Rejected, Pending) and access details about each claim.
Display a list of all submitted expense claims with their current status and basic details.
Review individual expense claims, verify the information provided, and approve or reject the claim based on company policies and budget constraints. Add any comments to explain the decision.
Navigate to the budget control module to analyze expenses by category, track remaining budget amounts, and identify potential overspending areas.
Display all saved information for a specific customer, including name, birthday, age, sex, company, phone number, preferred products and purchase history.

Enable customers to remove unwanted products from their preferences.
Access dashboards and reports displaying sales trends, best-selling products, customer demographics, and other relevant metrics for business insights.
Create detailed reports on individual products, including sales performance, profit margins, and inventory levels.
Define and manage customer segments based on purchasing behavior, demographics, or preferences. Use these segments for targeted marketing campaigns.
Utilize the system to schedule and send bulk email campaigns to specific customer segments or individual customers.
Filter and search products based on category, name, price range, or other criteria.
Display comprehensive information about a particular product, including name, description, category, recommended price, and customer reviews (if implemented).
Allow administrators to create new products and add them to the catalogue with relevant details (name, category, recommended price).

Allows the user to select the 'Spring Semester Subjects.xlsx' file containing subject information.
Displays the content of the selected Excel file, showing the existing subjects and their details.
Processes the imported data to organize it into a two-dimensional table structure based on subject name, weekday, and time slot.
Allows the user to customize the available time slots if they differ from the default options ('First period', 'Second period', 'Third period', 'Fourth period').
Enables the user to specify settings for the output Excel file, such as filename and location.
Creates a new Excel file containing the transformed subject table based on the selected settings.
Provide the location of the input dataset 'Gamedata.xlsx' which contains game information and player outcomes.
Specify the independent variables (features) that will be used to predict the 'result'. Ensure these columns are relevant to player outcomes.
Define the time lag for the 'result' variable. For example, specify if you want to predict the result of the next game based on the outcome of the previous one.
Train a logistic regression model using the selected features and lagged target variable.
Generate a comprehensive summary of the trained logistic model, including coefficients, R-squared value, accuracy, and other relevant metrics.
Set the name and location of the output file 'Logistic.xlsx' where the model summary will be saved.
